intro: Quamoclita, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces vines that can climb or trail along the ground. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Quamoclita is also known for its rapid growth and ability to spread quickly in suitable conditions.
